episodeTitle: Love is a Hurricane! Love-Love Hancock!
japaneseTitle: 恋はハリケーン！メロメロハンコック
description: Nyon diagnoses Hancock's mysterious illness as love sickness, revealing that Hancock has fallen in love with Luffy. Despite her sisters' concerns, Hancock agrees to help Luffy rescue Ace and boards Vice Admiral Momonga's ship with Luffy hidden. Meanwhile, at Marine Headquarters, Sengoku learns that the Whitebeard Pirates are mobilizing.

events.title: Nyon Diagnoses Love Sickness
events.description: Elder Nyon visits the ailing Hancock and correctly diagnoses her mysterious illness as love sickness. She explains that Hancock has fallen in love with Luffy, shocking Sandersonia and Marigold.
events.significance: Establishes the concept of love sickness in the Amazon Lily culture and reveals Hancock's true feelings for Luffy. This explains the fate of previous Kuja empresses who died from this condition.

quotes.text: All the previous empresses died from being away from their loved ones. This illness is called love sickness.
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Explaining Hancock's condition to her sisters

events.title: Love Sickness Explained
events.description: Nyon reveals the history of love sickness among Kuja empresses. She explains that when an empress falls in love and suppresses her emotions, it causes extreme pain and eventual death. Previous empresses died from this condition, but Nyon survived by leaving the island to follow her love.
events.significance: Provides crucial world-building about Amazon Lily's culture and the dangers faced by its empresses. Reveals that Nyon herself survived love sickness by leaving the island.

quotes.text: The feelings of emotion are like a hurricane, hitting when least expected. The victim suffers unbearable pain in their heart when their love attempts to leave the island.
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Describing the symptoms of love sickness

events.title: Hancock's Love for Luffy Confirmed
events.description: When Nyon mentions that Luffy wishes to see her, Hancock immediately recovers her strength and rushes to meet him. Her reaction confirms her deep feelings for Luffy, much to everyone's shock.
events.significance: Establishes one of the series' most significant character relationships. Hancock's love for Luffy becomes a defining trait of her character and motivates her crucial decisions going forward.

events.title: Hancock Agrees to Help Luffy
events.description: When Luffy asks Hancock to help him save his brother Ace, she shocks her sisters and Nyon by immediately agreeing. She declares she will happily answer the World Government's summons and go wherever Luffy wishes.
events.significance: This is a pivotal decision that sets in motion the events leading to Impel Down and Marineford. Hancock's decision to help Luffy demonstrates the depth of her feelings and her willingness to defy expectations.

quotes.text: I will help you save your brother. I will happily answer the call to war and go wherever you wish.
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Agreeing to help Luffy rescue Ace

events.title: Hancock Leaves Amazon Lily
events.description: Hancock prepares to leave Amazon Lily for the first time in years, boarding Vice Admiral Momonga's ship. She leaves the island in the care of her sisters, marking a significant moment for the Kuja.
events.significance: This departure is necessary for Hancock to cure her love sickness and represents a major change for Amazon Lily. It also sets up Hancock's role in the upcoming Summit War.

events.title: Hancock Unfreezes the Marines
events.description: Hancock uses her Mero Mero no Mi powers to unfreeze the Marines aboard Momonga's ship who she had previously turned to stone. The Marines resume their actions from before petrification with no memory of being frozen.
events.significance: Demonstrates an important aspect of Hancock's Devil Fruit abilities - that she can reverse the petrification at will, and victims have no memory of being frozen.

events.title: Luffy Hides on Marine Ship
events.description: Luffy hides beneath Hancock's robe aboard Vice Admiral Momonga's ship, beginning his dangerous infiltration toward Impel Down. This risky plan is the only way for Luffy to reach his brother Ace.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of Luffy's infiltration mission that will lead to the Impel Down arc. The plan requires complete trust between Luffy and Hancock.

events.title: Whitebeard Pirates Begin Moving
events.description: At Marine Headquarters, Sengoku receives news that all 23 Marine ships guarding Whitebeard's territory have vanished, confirming that the Whitebeard Pirates are mobilizing for war.
events.significance: This signals the beginning of the buildup to the Summit War of Marineford. The conflict between the World Government and the Whitebeard Pirates is escalating to an inevitable clash.

quotes.text: Don't annoy me unless it's about Whitebeard!
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Frustrated with the situation before receiving news of Whitebeard's movements

events.title: Jinbe Refuses to Fight Whitebeard
events.description: Sengoku reveals that Jinbe has refused to participate in the war against Whitebeard and was sent to Impel Down to 'cool his head' after causing a ruckus at Marine Headquarters.
events.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's loyalty to Whitebeard and his unwillingness to betray his principles despite being a Warlord. This foreshadows his eventual alliance with Luffy.

events.title: Garp Visits Ace in Impel Down
events.description: Monkey D. Garp arrives at Impel Down to visit his imprisoned grandson Ace. This emotional moment highlights the painful conflict between Garp's duty as a Marine and his love for his family.
events.significance: Emphasizes the personal tragedy of the upcoming war. Garp is torn between his Marine duty and his grandson's life, setting up the emotional stakes of the Marineford arc.

quotes.text: All the previous empresses died from being away from their loved ones. This illness is called love sickness.
quotes.speaker: Nyon

quotes.text: The feelings of emotion are like a hurricane, hitting when least expected.
quotes.speaker: Nyon

quotes.text: I will help you save your brother. I will happily answer the call to war and go wherever you wish.
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock

quotes.text: Don't annoy me unless it's about Whitebeard!
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: At Marine Headquarters dealing with the crisis

themes.description: The episode explores how love can be both a weakness and a strength. Hancock's love sickness threatens to kill her, but accepting her feelings and choosing to help Luffy actually saves her life.
themes.symbolism: Love sickness as a 'hurricane' represents the overwhelming and uncontrollable nature of romantic feelings.
culturalReferences: The concept of love sickness has roots in medieval and classical literature

themes.description: Multiple characters face conflicts between their official duties and personal connections. Hancock must choose between isolation and following her heart; Jinbe refuses to fight Whitebeard despite his Warlord position; Garp visits Ace despite the conflict between his Marine duty and family love.
themes.symbolism: The Marine ships being overwhelmed by Whitebeard symbolizes personal bonds overpowering institutional power.

themes.description: Hancock breaks Amazon Lily's tradition of isolation by leaving with a man. This represents personal growth and the willingness to challenge cultural norms for love.
themes.symbolism: Hancock leaving the island represents her emotional and personal journey beyond the constraints of her culture.
culturalReferences: Amazon Lily is based on the mythological Amazons of Greek legend

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock accepts her feelings for Luffy and makes the life-changing decision to leave Amazon Lily to help him. This marks her transformation from an isolated empress to someone willing to risk everything for love.
keyActions: Recovers when hearing Luffy wants to see her
Agrees to help Luffy rescue Ace
Leaves Amazon Lily for the first time in years
Unfreezes the Marines on Momonga's ship
Hides Luffy aboard the Marine vessel
quotes: I will help you save your brother. I will happily answer the call to war and go wherever you wish.

characterSpotlights.development: Nyon reveals her wisdom and past experience with love sickness, establishing herself as a crucial advisor who understands what Hancock is going through.
keyActions: Explains the history of love sickness among Kuja empresses
Advises Hancock to follow her heart
quotes: All the previous empresses died from being away from their loved ones. This illness is called love sickness.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's request for help motivates Hancock's decision and begins his dangerous journey to Impel Down. His trust in Hancock is unwavering.
keyActions: Asks Hancock to help him save Ace
Hides aboard Momonga's ship beneath Hancock's robe

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the emotional reactions of Sandersonia and Marigold when learning about Hancock's love sickness.
The scene at Marine Headquarters with Sengoku is slightly extended in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga chapters 522-523, specifically covering the end of Chapter 522 and pages 2-13 of Chapter 523.
The concept of 'love sickness' killing Amazon Lily empresses is unique to the One Piece world and adds depth to the Kuja culture.
This is the final episode of the Amazon Lily arc, which ran from episodes 408-417.

sources.title: Amazon Lily Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode aired with a TV rating of 11.2%, ranking 4th in its time slot.
Kotono Mitsuishi, Hancock's Japanese voice actress, is famous for also voicing Usagi Tsukino/Sailor Moon in the Sailor Moon series.
